body_text:
In bug 1401744 we found that the opt-out nothingburger study had a shutdown error that broke about:addons. To avoid future mistakes, I'd like to mark the extension as unusable on Normandy, so that it cannot be used in a recipe.
Open questions:

What should happen to studies that are currently set to use the extension when it is marked as unusable?
Should studies be able to be marked as usable again?
Should the upload URL for an unusable extension still return the extension file?

@MattGrimes Thoughts? Is this something we'd want?

title: Marking uploaded extensions as unusable or disabled
body:
In [bug 1401744](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1401744) we found that the opt-out nothingburger study had a shutdown error that broke `about:addons`. To avoid future mistakes, I'd like to mark the extension as unusable on Normandy, so that it cannot be used in a recipe. 

Open questions:
- What should happen to studies that are currently set to use the extension when it is marked as unusable?
- Should studies be able to be marked as usable again?
- Should the upload URL for an unusable extension still return the extension file?

@MattGrimes Thoughts? Is this something we'd want?
